text: are the two main resources for learning Flux right now (i) <https://fluxml.ai/tutorials.html> and (ii) the matt bauman julia academy course? (And I guess the model zoo.) Is there anything else I should look at?

elements.text: are the two main resources for learning Flux right now (i)
and (ii) the matt bauman julia academy course? (And I guess the model zoo.) Is there anything else I should look at?

text:
If you are asking about 'vanilla' ML/DL, I think the answer is that those are the most developed resources. Three other things that can be considered: 
1. There are several projects built on top of Flux or using Flux. See <https://fluxml.ai/ecosystem.html|https://fluxml.ai/ecosystem.html>. Each of those have their own examples. 
2. There seems to be a decent amount of interest in people improving the docs, examples, and libraries, and model zoo for GSOC. I would expect that as those people learn and improve the project that there will be some new resources. That discussion is mostly on Zulip.
3. The things <@U010XUS4MT7> is working on (FluxTraining, data pipelines, dataloaders) all have their own docs, and even if you didn't use his libraries, he shows how you can build things up from the basics. (The libraries seem good too)
